description: Meet Andrea. They are 2, and they live in downtown Seattle. Life is good for Andrea.

Carl is Andrea's neighbor, and life is not so great for Carl recently. Carl has had multiple, violent confrontations with the police in 2020. Carl is also mentally ill, and Andrea is concerned about their safety

Jonathan is running for Mayor. Jonathan wants to re-allocate 20% of the Seattle Police Department budget to mental illness prevention and support programs. Andrea votes for Jonathan in the Mayoral election.

Jonathan, the Mayor, appoints Khalid as Seattle's new Chief of Police. Khalid implements mandatory de-escalation training for all offices. Khalid also sets 20% of his budget to support mental health consultants co-responding to all behavioral crises cases.

After the election, Carl, Andrea's neighbor, gets into trouble again. Instead of a violent encounter with the police, however, Carl is met by two officers who de-escalate the situation. Carl is also provided resources and support from a mental health crisis consultant.
Andrea is a part of a complex local ecosystem in Seattle. Andrea has the power to help or hurt themselves, and those they care about, just by voting in local elections.
